- Motion to accept the Minutes of AGM held 20th November 2007.

Business Arising

Nil. VBA Treasurer vacancy covered at 8(a).

4. President's Report - Pat Barling

4.1 Volunteer Charter
The Volunteer Charter resulted from the March 2007 protest to Minister. This Charter will be with the Minister, not the Department so should gain improved ministerial consultation with volunteers. The Charter has been drafted by Pat Barling and Rob Gore, in consultation with Renee, based on the CFA model. A major aspect of the Charter is commitment from the Minister to get volunteer signoff on budget items.
  • Volunteer CFU, SES & RFS feedback on the Charter is requested.
  • Pat Barling to send Volunteer Charter to CFUs for feedback
  • Andrea Bolitho to send Volunteer Charter to SES Units for feedback
  • Ben Bryant to send Volunteer Charter to RFS Brigades for feedback
4.2 Inquiry into ACT Fire and Emergency Services Arrangements
The Standing Committee on Legal Affairs is conducting an inquiry into ACT Fire & Emergency Services Arrangements. VBA has the opportunity to make a submission, sit at the table and give evidence.
- Pat Barling to undertake VBA submission to inquiry and circulate to VBA members for information.

5. Treasurer's Report - Pat Barling

Significant funds are in the bank accounts earning interest.

6. SES Report - Jan Dachs

6.1 SES Update
  • November 2007 - 15 SES participated in an air search off the Victorian coastline for 1 day.
  • December 2007 - 7 SES units sent to Bankstown as part of hailstone taskforce and staging area provided for RFS at Mt Clear fire.
  • 20 volunteers trained in 2-day staging area course.
  • SES staff held a planning day regarding the business plan and goals.
6.2 SES volunteer representation
SES HQ is leading consultation with SES volunteers regarding VBA participation and options. All have been invited to participate. Response results have been collated and distributed to SES volunteers with outcomes expected by April 2008.

Pat Barling questioned the validity of the consultation results with a response rate of only 25% and quite misinformed feedback as to the role and activities undertaken by VBA.

- Pat Barling offered to meet with every SES Unit on request to answer questions on VBA role and actions to ensure SES volunteers make an informed choice and that they continue to be adequately represented.

6.3 Majura SES relocation
Majura SES relocation to Hackett is being finalised through ACTPLA with the move expected to occur in April 2008.

7. RFS Report - Tim McGuffog

7.1 Station relocation assessment
An initial station relocation assessment meeting was held 4 February 2008. This is basically the same assessment process that was undertaken 4 years ago. Generic volunteer points were made for consideration in assessment, particularly volunteer sense of ownership of stations and sourcing of brigade volunteers from local community suburbs critical.

The assessment has identified opportunities for fire brigade and ambulance cohabitation. All services have identified they need their own space, citing the Gunghalin experiment failure with sharing of common resources such as kitchens. A survey was sent out 5 February 2008 to Fire Brigade seeking their feedback.

Jan Dachs commented that SES is discussing virtues and costs of possible relocation and consolidation during assessment site visits.

7.2 RFS update
  • 3 vacant RFS positions have been filled temporarily with duty statements to be reviewed before advertising.
  • There are many issues with stores supplying gear that are being addressed.
  • A consultant has been selected to review the business plan.
  • RFS staff to brief Minister on Volunteer Charter.
  • Budget secured for instant management team training and confirmation expected on driver training soon.
  • RFS has noted and is also subject to the issue regarding lack of work cover traveling to and from the workplace.
  • The Commissioner has asked RFS to investigate purchase of an education tent for RFS like SES tent. VBA commented that this would be a waste given the Firewise (now farm firewise) trailer already exists for educational purposes.
7.3 NSW RFS Information Awareness Conference
The NSW RFS Information Awareness Conference is being held in Newcastle in May 2008. RFS can sponsor a delegate to attend as per Dave Wassall and Simon Butt in past years.
  • Tim McGuffog to forward invitation for delegate sponsorship to VBA
  • Any RFS volunteer interested in attending as VBA Conference delegate to contact Pat Barling.

8. General business

a. VBA Treasurer resignation [see Attachment 8 (a)]
Simon Butt resigned and VBA is seeking a new Treasurer. - Andrea Bolitho is to follow up potential nomination from Bec Noble of Rivers SES.

In his resignation letter, Simon recommended the withdrawal of Gunghalin RFS from the VBA. Pat reported that the Brigade Captain, John Jenkins, had indicated that the Brigade would retain its membership however the Brigade is not in agreement with this recommendation. Mike Lonergan commented that Pat Barling represents VBA very well as President.

Motion of confidence in Pat Barling as VBA Presdient.
Moved: Mike Lonergan
Seconded: Steve Angus
Motion Carried.

b. Work cover [see Attachment 8 (b)]

Pat Barling thanked Anthony Williamson for drafting the letter to the Minister regarding lack of work cover for volunteers traveling to and from sheds, sometimes in extreme weather conditions. One volunteer has already resigned due to this issue. Quick resolution of this issue is required for all volunteers.

- Pat Barling will raise this issue with the Minister when meeting with him 11 February 2008. c. Canberra Show

The Media Working Group decision to participate in the Home & Leisure Show rather than Canberra Show is definite. Volunteers are disappointed at not being consulted on this decision.

- Pat Barling will discuss this issue and the lack of volunteer consultation at his next meeting with the Minister on 11 February

Steve Angus suggests that in future VBA could approach the Royal Canberra Show Society directly to possibly source a discounted RFS-SES stand (usually $100+/m2). This is only worthwhile if volunteers are able to support stands. RFS brigades confirm support.

- SES units to feedback whether volunteers are able to support future stands at the Canberra Show.
d. Australasian Fire Authorities Council submission for Federal Budget [see Attachment 8 (d)]
The response deadline has expired. - Ben Bryant to set up reminder for consideration at end of 2008
e. Bushfire Council Report - Kevin Jeffrey
  • Bushfire Council had frank meeting with Commissioner, raising the issue of the delay in releasing meeting minutes due to the requirement for publishing approval for the ESA website standing up to him about non-compliance with Act where release of minutes is being delayed by publishing approval requirements for the ESA website. Bushfire Council is looking at options such as their own website.
  • Bushfire Council positions are available and expressions of interest are being sought.
  • Council looking at Inquiry issues.
  • Council discussed pushing information up the line about bushfire effect on water yield to inform the water authority debate.
  • Council is questioned bushfire readiness assessment.
  • Council questioned Commissioner Report which apparently has ROAG agreement with his position.
  • Council questioned Commissioner's decision regarding AFSM nomination, which is outside the fire area. The ACT is entitled to 2 positions on the AFSM - 1 RFS, 1 Fire Brigade.
- Pat to discuss the AFSM nomination issue with his meeting with the Minister.
